titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: Eileen Simpson (1918-2002) was the author of Poets in Their Youth : A Memoir (1982), Late Love : A Celebration of Marriage After Fifty (1994), The Maze, Reversals, Orphans Real and Imagined, and other works. She was married to the poet John Berryman for 11 years.

scopecontent.p: The Eileen Simpson Papers consist of material spanning the 1970s through the 1990s. The collection includes correspondence and other materials relating to her articles, books, and other writings. Included are letters to editors, publishers, agents, and from readers, drafts, reviews, interviews, and financial records, such as royalty statements and contracts.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An online finding aid is available at http://www.lib.udel.edu/ud/spec/findaids/simpson.htm.
